title: Commits for pull requests 237-239 not reachable from master
body:
Pull requests 237, 238 and 239 were submitted, but they are not reachable from KentBeck/junit:master (and, as far as I can tell, they are not reachable from any branch listed in KentBeck/junit). They are all reachable from https://github.com/KentBeck/junit/commit/7b5661e

Note that pull request 237 fixes a regression bug

title: Remove outdated content in release notes about TestRule being abstract
Automatic discovery of @Category annotations
Separate Classloaders for parallel methods
body:
Please add an option for executing each @Test in its own ClassLoader. This is especially important in parallel-methods mode where threads clobber each other's static variables.

See https://jira.codehaus.org/browse/SUREFIRE-749 for a more in-depth discussion.

title: Ability to specify @Listener on test class
body:
I've got a number of test classes using a couple different runners (via @RunWith) and I've found a need for which a RunListener would be very helpful.  Specifically, in case of an exception thrown by Selenium 2 using a RemoteWebDriver, we will get an exception with a ScreenshotException in the exception chain.  I've a RunListener that, on failure, looks through the received exception for this ScreenshotException and saves it to disk.

Unfortunately, I can't see an easy way to inject a specific RunListener implementation onto the RunNotifier other than providing a subclass Runner.  Since I'm using a variety of runners in this case, it would mean that I'd have to subclass multiple runners to accomplish this for all tests running Selenium 2.

An easier way, I think, would be to add support for a @Listener annotation on the test class that, when present, would be instantiated and added to the notifier during the run of that class and removed when completed.  ParentRunner.run looks like a suitable place for this, unless I'm mistaken.

title: Give InitializationError a useful message
protected BlockJUnit4ClassRunner#rules method removed from 4.8.2
Fixed issue #219
body: Fixed issue #219 where Assert.assertArrayEquals(float[],float[],float) displays an error message with doubles instead of floats. Let me know if there are any problems.

title: Potential resolution for issue 64, Theories vs. generic type parameters -- core JUnit changes only
body:
Setting up for resolving issue 64, Theories honoring generic type parameters. This commit comprises only those changes required in the core of JUnit -- basically adding a validator that the Theories runner can call to reject theories with generic type variables (that are hard to resolve), and deprecating FrameworkMethod#producesType, which only the Theories runner uses, and which will be supplanted by an equivalent method on ParameterSignature. Other required changes will be added to the Theories experiment once it migrates over to junit.contrib.

Previous pull request and commentary here: https://github.com/KentBeck/junit/pull/197

title: Attempt 2: Setting up for resolving issue 64, Theories honoring generic type parameters.
body: Attempt 2: Setting up for resolving issue 64, Theories honoring generic type parameters. This commit comprises only those changes required in the core of JUnit -- basically adding a validator that the Theories runner can call to reject theories with generic type variables (that are hard to resolve), and deprecating FrameworkMethod#producesType, which only the Theories runner uses, and which will be supplanted by an equivalent method on ParameterSignature. Other required changes will be added to the Theories experiment once it migrates over to junit.contrib.

I create a patch in a few minutes.

title: Missing static keyword on @ClassRule field causes NPE
body:
When the static keyword is missing on a field annotated by @ClassRule, a NullPointerException occurs.  For example:

```java
public class ClassRuleNPE {
    @ClassRule
    public ExternalResource resource = new ExternalResource() {    };

    @Test
    public void pass() {
        assertTrue(true);
    }
}
```

results in:
```
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at sun.reflect.UnsafeFieldAccessorImpl.ensureObj(UnsafeFieldAccessorImpl.java:36)
	at sun.reflect.UnsafeObjectFieldAccessorImpl.get(UnsafeObjectFieldAccessorImpl.java:18)
	at java.lang.reflect.Field.get(Field.java:358)
	at org.junit.runners.model.FrameworkField.get(FrameworkField.java:48)
	at org.junit.runners.ParentRunner.getClassRule(ParentRunner.java:212)
	at org.junit.runners.ParentRunner.classRules(ParentRunner.java:206)
	at org.junit.runners.ParentRunner.withClassRules(ParentRunner.java:194)
	at org.junit.runners.ParentRunner.classBlock(ParentRunner.java:153)
	at org.junit.runners.ParentRunner.run(ParentRunner.java:304)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit4.runner.JUnit4TestReference.run(JUnit4TestReference.java:49)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.TestExecution.run(TestExecution.java:38)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner.runTests(RemoteTestRunner.java:467)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner.runTests(RemoteTestRunner.java:683)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner.run(RemoteTestRunner.java:390)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner.main(RemoteTestRunner.java:197)
```

title: Non-public @ClassRule field results in strange exception message
body:
Running the following test:

```java
public class ClassRuleNonPublic {
    @ClassRule
    static ExternalResource resource = new ExternalResource() {    };

    @Test
    public void pass() {
        assertTrue(true);
    }
}
```

results in:
```
java.lang.RuntimeException: How did getAnnotatedFields return a field we couldn't access?
	at org.junit.runners.ParentRunner.getClassRule(ParentRunner.java:214)
	at org.junit.runners.ParentRunner.classRules(ParentRunner.java:206)
	at org.junit.runners.ParentRunner.withClassRules(ParentRunner.java:194)
	at org.junit.runners.ParentRunner.classBlock(ParentRunner.java:153)
	at org.junit.runners.ParentRunner.run(ParentRunner.java:304)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit4.runner.JUnit4TestReference.run(JUnit4TestReference.java:49)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.TestExecution.run(TestExecution.java:38)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner.runTests(RemoteTestRunner.java:467)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner.runTests(RemoteTestRunner.java:683)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner.run(RemoteTestRunner.java:390)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner.main(RemoteTestRunner.java:197)
```

I suggest the exception message be changed to something like "Field X must be public", where X is the field name.
